title: Karol Galba
text:
Dr Karol Galba (2 February 1921 – 15 November 2009) was <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="referee%20%28association%20football%29">official</a>, probably best known for being a <a href="Assistant%20referee%20%28association%20football%29">linesman</a> during the <a href="1966%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20Final">1966 FIFA World Cup Final</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>.
Background.
Galba, a <a href="Slovaks">Slovak</a>, was an experienced referee who had officiated at the <a href="1962%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1962 FIFA World Cup</a> and was, in charge of the <a href="Feyenoord">Feyenoord</a> vs <a href="Real%20Madrid">Real Madrid</a> tie on 8 September 1965 in which he brought an end to the match early in order to avoid a mass melee after the Spanish player <a href="Vicente%20Miera">Miera</a> fouled <a href="Coen%20Moulijn">Coen Moulijn</a>. Galba became President of the UEFA Referees' Committee when it was first instituted in 1968. He later worked as a match observer for UEFA.
He received the <a href="UEFA%20Order%20of%20Merit%20in%20Ruby">UEFA Order of Merit in Ruby</a>.
